083/**
084 * This class provides API to access backup system table<br>
085 * Backup system table schema:<br>
086 * <p>
087 * <ul>
088 * <li>1. Backup sessions rowkey= "session:"+backupId; value =serialized BackupInfo</li>
089 * <li>2. Backup start code rowkey = "startcode:"+backupRoot; value = startcode</li>
090 * <li>3. Incremental backup set rowkey="incrbackupset:"+backupRoot; table="meta:"+tablename of
091 * include table; value=empty</li>
092 * <li>4. Table-RS-timestamp map rowkey="trslm:"+backupRoot+table_name; value = map[RS-> last WAL
093 * timestamp]</li>
094 * <li>5. RS - WAL ts map rowkey="rslogts:"+backupRoot +server; value = last WAL timestamp</li>
095 * <li>6. WALs recorded rowkey="wals:"+WAL unique file name; value = backupId and full WAL file
096 * name</li>
097 * </ul>
098 * </p>
099 */
100@InterfaceAudience.Private
101public final class BackupSystemTable implements Closeable {
102
103  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BackupSystemTable.class);
104
105  static class WALItem {
106    String backupId;
107    String walFile;
108    String backupRoot;
109
110    WALItem(String backupId, String walFile, String backupRoot) {
111      this.backupId = backupId;
112      this.walFile = walFile;
113      this.backupRoot = backupRoot;
114    }
115
116    public String getBackupId() {
117      return backupId;
118    }
119
120    public String getWalFile() {
121      return walFile;
122    }
123
124    public String getBackupRoot() {
125      return backupRoot;
126    }
127
128    @Override
129    public String toString() {
130      return Path.SEPARATOR + backupRoot + Path.SEPARATOR + backupId + Path.SEPARATOR + walFile;
131    }
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Backup system table (main) name
136   */
137  private TableName tableName;
138
139  /**
140   * Backup System table name for bulk loaded files. We keep all bulk loaded file references in a
141   * separate table because we have to isolate general backup operations: create, merge etc from
142   * activity of RegionObserver, which controls process of a bulk loading
143   * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.backup.BackupObserver}
144   */
145  private TableName bulkLoadTableName;
146
147  /**
148   * Stores backup sessions (contexts)
149   */
150  final static byte[] SESSIONS_FAMILY = Bytes.toBytes("session");
151  /**
152   * Stores other meta
153   */
154  final static byte[] META_FAMILY = Bytes.toBytes("meta");
155  final static byte[] BULK_LOAD_FAMILY = Bytes.toBytes("bulk");
156  /**
157   * Connection to HBase cluster, shared among all instances
158   */
159  private final Connection connection;
160
161  private final static String BACKUP_INFO_PREFIX = "session:";
162  private final static String START_CODE_ROW = "startcode:";
163  private final static byte[] ACTIVE_SESSION_ROW = Bytes.toBytes("activesession:");
164  private final static byte[] ACTIVE_SESSION_COL = Bytes.toBytes("c");
165
166  private final static byte[] ACTIVE_SESSION_YES = Bytes.toBytes("yes");
167  private final static byte[] ACTIVE_SESSION_NO = Bytes.toBytes("no");
168
169  private final static String INCR_BACKUP_SET = "incrbackupset:";
170  private final static String TABLE_RS_LOG_MAP_PREFIX = "trslm:";
171  private final static String RS_LOG_TS_PREFIX = "rslogts:";
172
173  private final static String BULK_LOAD_PREFIX = "bulk:";
174  private final static byte[] BULK_LOAD_PREFIX_BYTES = Bytes.toBytes(BULK_LOAD_PREFIX);
175  private final static byte[] DELETE_OP_ROW = Bytes.toBytes("delete_op_row");
176  private final static byte[] MERGE_OP_ROW = Bytes.toBytes("merge_op_row");
177
178  final static byte[] TBL_COL = Bytes.toBytes("tbl");
179  final static byte[] FAM_COL = Bytes.toBytes("fam");
180  final static byte[] PATH_COL = Bytes.toBytes("path");
181  final static byte[] STATE_COL = Bytes.toBytes("state");
182  // the two states a bulk loaded file can be
183  final static byte[] BL_PREPARE = Bytes.toBytes("R");
184  final static byte[] BL_COMMIT = Bytes.toBytes("D");
185
186  private final static String SET_KEY_PREFIX = "backupset:";
187
188  // separator between BULK_LOAD_PREFIX and ordinals
189  private final static String BLK_LD_DELIM = ":";
190  private final static byte[] EMPTY_VALUE = new byte[] {};
191
192  // Safe delimiter in a string
193  private final static String NULL = "\u0000";
194
195  public BackupSystemTable(Connection conn) throws IOException {
196    this.connection = conn;
197    Configuration conf = this.connection.getConfiguration();
198    tableName = BackupSystemTable.getTableName(conf);
199    bulkLoadTableName = BackupSystemTable.getTableNameForBulkLoadedData(conf);
200    checkSystemTable();
201  }
202
203  private void checkSystemTable() throws IOException {
204    try (Admin admin = connection.getAdmin()) {
205      verifyNamespaceExists(admin);
206      Configuration conf = connection.getConfiguration();
207      if (!admin.tableExists(tableName)) {
208        TableDescriptor backupHTD = BackupSystemTable.getSystemTableDescriptor(conf);
209        createSystemTable(admin, backupHTD);
210      }
211      ensureTableEnabled(admin, tableName);
212      if (!admin.tableExists(bulkLoadTableName)) {
213        TableDescriptor blHTD = BackupSystemTable.getSystemTableForBulkLoadedDataDescriptor(conf);
214        createSystemTable(admin, blHTD);
215      }
216      ensureTableEnabled(admin, bulkLoadTableName);
217      waitForSystemTable(admin, tableName);
218      waitForSystemTable(admin, bulkLoadTableName);
219    }
220  }
221
222  private void createSystemTable(Admin admin, TableDescriptor descriptor) throws IOException {
223    try {
224      admin.createTable(descriptor);
225    } catch (TableExistsException e) {
226      // swallow because this class is initialized in concurrent environments (i.e. bulkloads),
227      // so may be subject to race conditions where one caller succeeds in creating the
228      // table and others fail because it now exists
229      LOG.debug("Table {} already exists, ignoring", descriptor.getTableName(), e);
230    }
231  }
232
233  private void verifyNamespaceExists(Admin admin) throws IOException {
234    String namespaceName = tableName.getNamespaceAsString();
235    NamespaceDescriptor ns = NamespaceDescriptor.create(namespaceName).build();
236    NamespaceDescriptor[] list = admin.listNamespaceDescriptors();
237    boolean exists = false;
238    for (NamespaceDescriptor nsd : list) {
239      if (nsd.getName().equals(ns.getName())) {
240        exists = true;
241        break;
242      }
243    }
244    if (!exists) {
245      try {
246        admin.createNamespace(ns);
247      } catch (NamespaceExistException e) {
248        // swallow because this class is initialized in concurrent environments (i.e. bulkloads),
249        // so may be subject to race conditions where one caller succeeds in creating the
250        // namespace and others fail because it now exists
251        LOG.debug("Namespace {} already exists, ignoring", ns.getName(), e);
252      }
253    }
254  }
255
256  private void waitForSystemTable(Admin admin, TableName tableName) throws IOException {
257    // Return fast if the table is available and avoid a log message
258    if (admin.tableExists(tableName) && admin.isTableAvailable(tableName)) {
259      return;
260    }
261    long TIMEOUT = 60000;
262    long startTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
263    LOG.debug("Backup table {} is not present and available, waiting for it to become so",
264      tableName);
265    while (!admin.tableExists(tableName) || !admin.isTableAvailable(tableName)) {
266      try {
267        Thread.sleep(100);
268      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
269        throw (IOException) new InterruptedIOException().initCause(e);
270      }
271      if (EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() - startTime > TIMEOUT) {
272        throw new IOException(
273          "Failed to create backup system table " + tableName + " after " + TIMEOUT + "ms");
274      }
275    }
276    LOG.debug("Backup table {} exists and available", tableName);
277  }
278
279  @Override
280  public void close() {
281    // do nothing
282  }
283
284  /**
285   * Updates status (state) of a backup session in backup system table table
286   * @param info backup info
287   * @throws IOException exception
288   */
289  public void updateBackupInfo(BackupInfo info) throws IOException {
290    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
291      LOG.trace("update backup status in backup system table for: " + info.getBackupId()
292        + " set status=" + info.getState());
293    }
294    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
295      Put put = createPutForBackupInfo(info);
296      table.put(put);
297    }
298  }
299
300  /*
301   * @param backupId the backup Id
302   * @return Map of rows to path of bulk loaded hfile
303   */
304  Map<byte[], String> readBulkLoadedFiles(String backupId) throws IOException {
305    Scan scan = BackupSystemTable.createScanForBulkLoadedFiles(backupId);
306    try (Table table = connection.getTable(bulkLoadTableName);
307      ResultScanner scanner = table.getScanner(scan)) {
308      Result res = null;
309      Map<byte[], String> map = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
310      while ((res = scanner.next()) != null) {
311        res.advance();
312        byte[] row = CellUtil.cloneRow(res.listCells().get(0));
313        for (Cell cell : res.listCells()) {
314          if (
315            CellUtil.compareQualifiers(cell, BackupSystemTable.PATH_COL, 0,
316              BackupSystemTable.PATH_COL.length) == 0
317          ) {
318            map.put(row, Bytes.toString(CellUtil.cloneValue(cell)));
319          }
320        }
321      }
322      return map;
323    }
324  }
325
326  /*
327   * Used during restore
328   * @param backupId the backup Id
329   * @param sTableList List of tables
330   * @return array of Map of family to List of Paths
331   */
332  public Map<byte[], List<Path>>[] readBulkLoadedFiles(String backupId, List<TableName> sTableList)
333    throws IOException {
334    Scan scan = BackupSystemTable.createScanForBulkLoadedFiles(backupId);
335    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
336    Map<byte[], List<Path>>[] mapForSrc = new Map[sTableList == null ? 1 : sTableList.size()];
337    try (Table table = connection.getTable(bulkLoadTableName);
338      ResultScanner scanner = table.getScanner(scan)) {
339      Result res = null;
340      while ((res = scanner.next()) != null) {
341        res.advance();
342        TableName tbl = null;
343        byte[] fam = null;
344        String path = null;
345        for (Cell cell : res.listCells()) {
346          if (
347            CellUtil.compareQualifiers(cell, BackupSystemTable.TBL_COL, 0,
348              BackupSystemTable.TBL_COL.length) == 0
349          ) {
350            tbl = TableName.valueOf(CellUtil.cloneValue(cell));
351          } else if (
352            CellUtil.compareQualifiers(cell, BackupSystemTable.FAM_COL, 0,
353              BackupSystemTable.FAM_COL.length) == 0
354          ) {
355            fam = CellUtil.cloneValue(cell);
356          } else if (
357            CellUtil.compareQualifiers(cell, BackupSystemTable.PATH_COL, 0,
358              BackupSystemTable.PATH_COL.length) == 0
359          ) {
360            path = Bytes.toString(CellUtil.cloneValue(cell));
361          }
362        }
363        int srcIdx = IncrementalTableBackupClient.getIndex(tbl, sTableList);
364        if (srcIdx == -1) {
365          // the table is not among the query
366          continue;
367        }
368        if (mapForSrc[srcIdx] == null) {
369          mapForSrc[srcIdx] = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
370        }
371        List<Path> files;
372        if (!mapForSrc[srcIdx].containsKey(fam)) {
373          files = new ArrayList<Path>();
374          mapForSrc[srcIdx].put(fam, files);
375        } else {
376          files = mapForSrc[srcIdx].get(fam);
377        }
378        files.add(new Path(path));
379        if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
380          LOG.debug("found bulk loaded file : " + tbl + " " + Bytes.toString(fam) + " " + path);
381        }
382      }
383
384      return mapForSrc;
385    }
386  }
387
388  /**
389   * Deletes backup status from backup system table table
390   * @param backupId backup id
391   * @throws IOException exception
392   */
393  public void deleteBackupInfo(String backupId) throws IOException {
394    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
395      LOG.trace("delete backup status in backup system table for " + backupId);
396    }
397    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
398      Delete del = createDeleteForBackupInfo(backupId);
399      table.delete(del);
400    }
401  }
402
403  /*
404   * For postBulkLoadHFile() hook.
405   * @param tabName table name
406   * @param region the region receiving hfile
407   * @param finalPaths family and associated hfiles
408   */
409  public void writePathsPostBulkLoad(TableName tabName, byte[] region,
410    Map<byte[], List<Path>> finalPaths) throws IOException {
411    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
412      LOG.debug("write bulk load descriptor to backup " + tabName + " with " + finalPaths.size()
413        + " entries");
414    }
415    try (Table table = connection.getTable(bulkLoadTableName)) {
416      List<Put> puts = BackupSystemTable.createPutForCommittedBulkload(tabName, region, finalPaths);
417      table.put(puts);
418      LOG.debug("written " + puts.size() + " rows for bulk load of " + tabName);
419    }
420  }
421
422  /*
423   * For preCommitStoreFile() hook
424   * @param tabName table name
425   * @param region the region receiving hfile
426   * @param family column family
427   * @param pairs list of paths for hfiles
428   */
429  public void writeFilesForBulkLoadPreCommit(TableName tabName, byte[] region, final byte[] family,
430    final List<Pair<Path, Path>> pairs) throws IOException {
431    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
432      LOG.debug(
433        "write bulk load descriptor to backup " + tabName + " with " + pairs.size() + " entries");
434    }
435    try (Table table = connection.getTable(bulkLoadTableName)) {
436      List<Put> puts =
437        BackupSystemTable.createPutForPreparedBulkload(tabName, region, family, pairs);
438      table.put(puts);
439      LOG.debug("written " + puts.size() + " rows for bulk load of " + tabName);
440    }
441  }
442
443  /*
444   * Removes rows recording bulk loaded hfiles from backup table
445   * @param lst list of table names
446   * @param rows the rows to be deleted
447   */
448  public void deleteBulkLoadedRows(List<byte[]> rows) throws IOException {
449    try (Table table = connection.getTable(bulkLoadTableName)) {
450      List<Delete> lstDels = new ArrayList<>();
451      for (byte[] row : rows) {
452        Delete del = new Delete(row);
453        lstDels.add(del);
454        LOG.debug("orig deleting the row: " + Bytes.toString(row));
455      }
456      table.delete(lstDels);
457      LOG.debug("deleted " + rows.size() + " original bulkload rows");
458    }
459  }
460
461  /*
462   * Reads the rows from backup table recording bulk loaded hfiles
463   * @param tableList list of table names
464   * @return The keys of the Map are table, region and column family. Value of the map reflects
465   * whether the hfile was recorded by preCommitStoreFile hook (true)
466   */
467  public Pair<Map<TableName, Map<String, Map<String, List<Pair<String, Boolean>>>>>, List<byte[]>>
468    readBulkloadRows(List<TableName> tableList) throws IOException {
469
470    Map<TableName, Map<String, Map<String, List<Pair<String, Boolean>>>>> map = new HashMap<>();
471    List<byte[]> rows = new ArrayList<>();
472    for (TableName tTable : tableList) {
473      Scan scan = BackupSystemTable.createScanForOrigBulkLoadedFiles(tTable);
474      Map<String, Map<String, List<Pair<String, Boolean>>>> tblMap = map.get(tTable);
475      try (Table table = connection.getTable(bulkLoadTableName);
476        ResultScanner scanner = table.getScanner(scan)) {
477        Result res = null;
478        while ((res = scanner.next()) != null) {
479          res.advance();
480          String fam = null;
481          String path = null;
482          boolean raw = false;
483          byte[] row;
484          String region = null;
485          for (Cell cell : res.listCells()) {
486            row = CellUtil.cloneRow(cell);
487            rows.add(row);
488            String rowStr = Bytes.toString(row);
489            region = BackupSystemTable.getRegionNameFromOrigBulkLoadRow(rowStr);
490            if (
491              CellUtil.compareQualifiers(cell, BackupSystemTable.FAM_COL, 0,
492                BackupSystemTable.FAM_COL.length) == 0
493            ) {
494              fam = Bytes.toString(CellUtil.cloneValue(cell));
495            } else if (
496              CellUtil.compareQualifiers(cell, BackupSystemTable.PATH_COL, 0,
497                BackupSystemTable.PATH_COL.length) == 0
498            ) {
499              path = Bytes.toString(CellUtil.cloneValue(cell));
500            } else if (
501              CellUtil.compareQualifiers(cell, BackupSystemTable.STATE_COL, 0,
502                BackupSystemTable.STATE_COL.length) == 0
503            ) {
504              byte[] state = CellUtil.cloneValue(cell);
505              if (Bytes.equals(BackupSystemTable.BL_PREPARE, state)) {
506                raw = true;
507              } else {
508                raw = false;
509              }
510            }
511          }
512          if (map.get(tTable) == null) {
513            map.put(tTable, new HashMap<>());
514            tblMap = map.get(tTable);
515          }
516          if (tblMap.get(region) == null) {
517            tblMap.put(region, new HashMap<>());
518          }
519          Map<String, List<Pair<String, Boolean>>> famMap = tblMap.get(region);
520          if (famMap.get(fam) == null) {
521            famMap.put(fam, new ArrayList<>());
522          }
523          famMap.get(fam).add(new Pair<>(path, raw));
524          LOG.debug("found orig " + path + " for " + fam + " of table " + region);
525        }
526      }
527    }
528    return new Pair<>(map, rows);
529  }
530
531  /*
532   * @param sTableList List of tables
533   * @param maps array of Map of family to List of Paths
534   * @param backupId the backup Id
535   */
536  public void writeBulkLoadedFiles(List<TableName> sTableList, Map<byte[], List<Path>>[] maps,
537    String backupId) throws IOException {
538    try (Table table = connection.getTable(bulkLoadTableName)) {
539      long ts = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
540      int cnt = 0;
541      List<Put> puts = new ArrayList<>();
542      for (int idx = 0; idx < maps.length; idx++) {
543        Map<byte[], List<Path>> map = maps[idx];
544        TableName tn = sTableList.get(idx);
545
546        if (map == null) {
547          continue;
548        }
549
550        for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<Path>> entry : map.entrySet()) {
551          byte[] fam = entry.getKey();
552          List<Path> paths = entry.getValue();
553          for (Path p : paths) {
554            Put put = BackupSystemTable.createPutForBulkLoadedFile(tn, fam, p.toString(), backupId,
555              ts, cnt++);
556            puts.add(put);
557          }
558        }
559      }
560      if (!puts.isEmpty()) {
561        table.put(puts);
562      }
563    }
564  }
565
566  /**
567   * Reads backup status object (instance of backup info) from backup system table table
568   * @param backupId backup id
569   * @return Current status of backup session or null
570   */
571  public BackupInfo readBackupInfo(String backupId) throws IOException {
572    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
573      LOG.trace("read backup status from backup system table for: " + backupId);
574    }
575
576    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
577      Get get = createGetForBackupInfo(backupId);
578      Result res = table.get(get);
579      if (res.isEmpty()) {
580        return null;
581      }
582      return resultToBackupInfo(res);
583    }
584  }
585
586  /**
587   * Read the last backup start code (timestamp) of last successful backup. Will return null if
588   * there is no start code stored on hbase or the value is of length 0. These two cases indicate
589   * there is no successful backup completed so far.
590   * @param backupRoot directory path to backup destination
591   * @return the timestamp of last successful backup
592   * @throws IOException exception
593   */
594  public String readBackupStartCode(String backupRoot) throws IOException {
595    LOG.trace("read backup start code from backup system table");
596
597    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
598      Get get = createGetForStartCode(backupRoot);
599      Result res = table.get(get);
600      if (res.isEmpty()) {
601        return null;
602      }
603      Cell cell = res.listCells().get(0);
604      byte[] val = CellUtil.cloneValue(cell);
605      if (val.length == 0) {
606        return null;
607      }
608      return new String(val, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
609    }
610  }
611
612  /**
613   * Write the start code (timestamp) to backup system table. If passed in null, then write 0 byte.
614   * @param startCode  start code
615   * @param backupRoot root directory path to backup
616   * @throws IOException exception
617   */
618  public void writeBackupStartCode(Long startCode, String backupRoot) throws IOException {
619    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
620      LOG.trace("write backup start code to backup system table " + startCode);
621    }
622    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
623      Put put = createPutForStartCode(startCode.toString(), backupRoot);
624      table.put(put);
625    }
626  }
627
628  /**
629   * Exclusive operations are: create, delete, merge
630   * @throws IOException if a table operation fails or an active backup exclusive operation is
631   *                     already underway
632   */
633  public void startBackupExclusiveOperation() throws IOException {
634    LOG.debug("Start new backup exclusive operation");
635
636    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
637      Put put = createPutForStartBackupSession();
638      // First try to put if row does not exist
639      if (
640        !table.checkAndMutate(ACTIVE_SESSION_ROW, SESSIONS_FAMILY).qualifier(ACTIVE_SESSION_COL)
641          .ifNotExists().thenPut(put)
642      ) {
643        // Row exists, try to put if value == ACTIVE_SESSION_NO
644        if (
645          !table.checkAndMutate(ACTIVE_SESSION_ROW, SESSIONS_FAMILY).qualifier(ACTIVE_SESSION_COL)
646            .ifEquals(ACTIVE_SESSION_NO).thenPut(put)
647        ) {
648          throw new ExclusiveOperationException();
649        }
650      }
651    }
652  }
653
654  private Put createPutForStartBackupSession() {
655    Put put = new Put(ACTIVE_SESSION_ROW);
656    put.addColumn(SESSIONS_FAMILY, ACTIVE_SESSION_COL, ACTIVE_SESSION_YES);
657    return put;
658  }
659
660  public void finishBackupExclusiveOperation() throws IOException {
661    LOG.debug("Finish backup exclusive operation");
662
663    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
664      Put put = createPutForStopBackupSession();
665      if (
666        !table.checkAndMutate(ACTIVE_SESSION_ROW, SESSIONS_FAMILY).qualifier(ACTIVE_SESSION_COL)
667          .ifEquals(ACTIVE_SESSION_YES).thenPut(put)
668      ) {
669        throw new IOException("There is no active backup exclusive operation");
670      }
671    }
672  }
673
674  private Put createPutForStopBackupSession() {
675    Put put = new Put(ACTIVE_SESSION_ROW);
676    put.addColumn(SESSIONS_FAMILY, ACTIVE_SESSION_COL, ACTIVE_SESSION_NO);
677    return put;
678  }
679
680  /**
681   * Get the Region Servers log information after the last log roll from backup system table.
682   * @param backupRoot root directory path to backup
683   * @return RS log info
684   * @throws IOException exception
685   */
686  public HashMap<String, Long> readRegionServerLastLogRollResult(String backupRoot)
687    throws IOException {
688    LOG.trace("read region server last roll log result to backup system table");
689
690    Scan scan = createScanForReadRegionServerLastLogRollResult(backupRoot);
691
692    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName);
693      ResultScanner scanner = table.getScanner(scan)) {
694      Result res;
695      HashMap<String, Long> rsTimestampMap = new HashMap<>();
696      while ((res = scanner.next()) != null) {
697        res.advance();
698        Cell cell = res.current();
699        byte[] row = CellUtil.cloneRow(cell);
700        String server = getServerNameForReadRegionServerLastLogRollResult(row);
701        byte[] data = CellUtil.cloneValue(cell);
702        rsTimestampMap.put(server, Bytes.toLong(data));
703      }
704      return rsTimestampMap;
705    }
706  }
707
708  /**
709   * Writes Region Server last roll log result (timestamp) to backup system table table
710   * @param server     Region Server name
711   * @param ts         last log timestamp
712   * @param backupRoot root directory path to backup
713   * @throws IOException exception
714   */
715  public void writeRegionServerLastLogRollResult(String server, Long ts, String backupRoot)
716    throws IOException {
717    LOG.trace("write region server last roll log result to backup system table");
718
719    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
720      Put put = createPutForRegionServerLastLogRollResult(server, ts, backupRoot);
721      table.put(put);
722    }
723  }
724
725  /**
726   * Get all completed backup information (in desc order by time)
727   * @param onlyCompleted true, if only successfully completed sessions
728   * @return history info of BackupCompleteData
729   * @throws IOException exception
730   */
731  public ArrayList<BackupInfo> getBackupHistory(boolean onlyCompleted) throws IOException {
732    LOG.trace("get backup history from backup system table");
733
734    BackupState state = onlyCompleted ? BackupState.COMPLETE : BackupState.ANY;
735    ArrayList<BackupInfo> list = getBackupInfos(state);
736    return BackupUtils.sortHistoryListDesc(list);
737  }
738
739  /**
740   * Get all backups history
741   * @return list of backup info
742   * @throws IOException if getting the backup history fails
743   */
744  public List<BackupInfo> getBackupHistory() throws IOException {
745    return getBackupHistory(false);
746  }
747
748  /**
749   * Get first n backup history records
750   * @param n number of records, if n== -1 - max number is ignored
751   * @return list of records
752   * @throws IOException if getting the backup history fails
753   */
754  public List<BackupInfo> getHistory(int n) throws IOException {
755    List<BackupInfo> history = getBackupHistory();
756    if (n == -1 || history.size() <= n) {
757      return history;
758    }
759    return Collections.unmodifiableList(history.subList(0, n));
760  }
761
762  /**
763   * Get backup history records filtered by list of filters.
764   * @param n       max number of records, if n == -1 , then max number is ignored
765   * @param filters list of filters
766   * @return backup records
767   * @throws IOException if getting the backup history fails
768   */
769  public List<BackupInfo> getBackupHistory(int n, BackupInfo.Filter... filters) throws IOException {
770    if (filters.length == 0) {
771      return getHistory(n);
772    }
773
774    List<BackupInfo> history = getBackupHistory();
775    List<BackupInfo> result = new ArrayList<>();
776    for (BackupInfo bi : history) {
777      if (n >= 0 && result.size() == n) {
778        break;
779      }
780
781      boolean passed = true;
782      for (int i = 0; i < filters.length; i++) {
783        if (!filters[i].apply(bi)) {
784          passed = false;
785          break;
786        }
787      }
788      if (passed) {
789        result.add(bi);
790      }
791    }
792    return result;
793  }
794
795  /*
796   * Retrieve TableName's for completed backup of given type
797   * @param type backup type
798   * @return List of table names
799   */
800  public List<TableName> getTablesForBackupType(BackupType type) throws IOException {
801    Set<TableName> names = new HashSet<>();
802    List<BackupInfo> infos = getBackupHistory(true);
803    for (BackupInfo info : infos) {
804      if (info.getType() == type) {
805        names.addAll(info.getTableNames());
806      }
807    }
808    return new ArrayList<>(names);
809  }
810
811  /**
812   * Get history for backup destination
813   * @param backupRoot backup destination path
814   * @return List of backup info
815   * @throws IOException if getting the backup history fails
816   */
817  public List<BackupInfo> getBackupHistory(String backupRoot) throws IOException {
818    ArrayList<BackupInfo> history = getBackupHistory(false);
819    for (Iterator<BackupInfo> iterator = history.iterator(); iterator.hasNext();) {
820      BackupInfo info = iterator.next();
821      if (!backupRoot.equals(info.getBackupRootDir())) {
822        iterator.remove();
823      }
824    }
825    return history;
826  }
827
828  /**
829   * Get history for a table
830   * @param name table name
831   * @return history for a table
832   * @throws IOException if getting the backup history fails
833   */
834  public List<BackupInfo> getBackupHistoryForTable(TableName name) throws IOException {
835    List<BackupInfo> history = getBackupHistory();
836    List<BackupInfo> tableHistory = new ArrayList<>();
837    for (BackupInfo info : history) {
838      List<TableName> tables = info.getTableNames();
839      if (tables.contains(name)) {
840        tableHistory.add(info);
841      }
842    }
843    return tableHistory;
844  }
845
846  /**
847   * Goes through all backup history corresponding to the provided root folder, and collects all
848   * backup info mentioning each of the provided tables.
849   * @param set        the tables for which to collect the {@code BackupInfo}
850   * @param backupRoot backup destination path to retrieve backup history for
851   * @return a map containing (a subset of) the provided {@code TableName}s, mapped to a list of at
852   *         least one {@code BackupInfo}
853   * @throws IOException if getting the backup history fails
854   */
855  public Map<TableName, List<BackupInfo>> getBackupHistoryForTableSet(Set<TableName> set,
856    String backupRoot) throws IOException {
857    List<BackupInfo> history = getBackupHistory(backupRoot);
858    Map<TableName, List<BackupInfo>> tableHistoryMap = new HashMap<>();
859    for (BackupInfo info : history) {
860      List<TableName> tables = info.getTableNames();
861      for (TableName tableName : tables) {
862        if (set.contains(tableName)) {
863          List<BackupInfo> list =
864            tableHistoryMap.computeIfAbsent(tableName, k -> new ArrayList<>());
865          list.add(info);
866        }
867      }
868    }
869    return tableHistoryMap;
870  }
871
872  /**
873   * Get all backup sessions with a given state (in descending order by time)
874   * @param state backup session state
875   * @return history info of backup info objects
876   * @throws IOException exception
877   */
878  public ArrayList<BackupInfo> getBackupInfos(BackupState state) throws IOException {
879    LOG.trace("get backup infos from backup system table");
880
881    Scan scan = createScanForBackupHistory();
882    ArrayList<BackupInfo> list = new ArrayList<>();
883
884    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName);
885      ResultScanner scanner = table.getScanner(scan)) {
886      Result res;
887      while ((res = scanner.next()) != null) {
888        res.advance();
889        BackupInfo context = cellToBackupInfo(res.current());
890        if (state != BackupState.ANY && context.getState() != state) {
891          continue;
892        }
893        list.add(context);
894      }
895      return list;
896    }
897  }
898
899  /**
900   * Write the current timestamps for each regionserver to backup system table after a successful
901   * full or incremental backup. The saved timestamp is of the last log file that was backed up
902   * already.
903   * @param tables        tables
904   * @param newTimestamps timestamps
905   * @param backupRoot    root directory path to backup
906   * @throws IOException exception
907   */
908  public void writeRegionServerLogTimestamp(Set<TableName> tables, Map<String, Long> newTimestamps,
909    String backupRoot) throws IOException {
910    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
911      LOG.trace("write RS log time stamps to backup system table for tables ["
912        + StringUtils.join(tables, ",") + "]");
913    }
914    List<Put> puts = new ArrayList<>();
915    for (TableName table : tables) {
916      byte[] smapData = toTableServerTimestampProto(table, newTimestamps).toByteArray();
917      Put put = createPutForWriteRegionServerLogTimestamp(table, smapData, backupRoot);
918      puts.add(put);
919    }
920    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
921      table.put(puts);
922    }
923  }
924
925  /**
926   * Read the timestamp for each region server log after the last successful backup. Each table has
927   * its own set of the timestamps. The info is stored for each table as a concatenated string of
928   * rs->timestapmp
929   * @param backupRoot root directory path to backup
930   * @return the timestamp for each region server. key: tableName value:
931   *         RegionServer,PreviousTimeStamp
932   * @throws IOException exception
933   */
934  public Map<TableName, Map<String, Long>> readLogTimestampMap(String backupRoot)
935    throws IOException {
936    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
937      LOG.trace("read RS log ts from backup system table for root=" + backupRoot);
938    }
939
940    Map<TableName, Map<String, Long>> tableTimestampMap = new HashMap<>();
941
942    Scan scan = createScanForReadLogTimestampMap(backupRoot);
943    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName);
944      ResultScanner scanner = table.getScanner(scan)) {
945      Result res;
946      while ((res = scanner.next()) != null) {
947        res.advance();
948        Cell cell = res.current();
949        byte[] row = CellUtil.cloneRow(cell);
950        String tabName = getTableNameForReadLogTimestampMap(row);
951        TableName tn = TableName.valueOf(tabName);
952        byte[] data = CellUtil.cloneValue(cell);
953        if (data == null) {
954          throw new IOException("Data of last backup data from backup system table "
955            + "is empty. Create a backup first.");
956        }
957        if (data != null && data.length > 0) {
958          HashMap<String, Long> lastBackup =
959            fromTableServerTimestampProto(BackupProtos.TableServerTimestamp.parseFrom(data));
960          tableTimestampMap.put(tn, lastBackup);
961        }
962      }
963      return tableTimestampMap;
964    }
965  }
966
967  private BackupProtos.TableServerTimestamp toTableServerTimestampProto(TableName table,
968    Map<String, Long> map) {
969    BackupProtos.TableServerTimestamp.Builder tstBuilder =
970      BackupProtos.TableServerTimestamp.newBuilder();
971    tstBuilder
972      .setTableName(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shaded.protobuf.ProtobufUtil.toProtoTableName(table));
973
974    for (Entry<String, Long> entry : map.entrySet()) {
975      BackupProtos.ServerTimestamp.Builder builder = BackupProtos.ServerTimestamp.newBuilder();
976      HBaseProtos.ServerName.Builder snBuilder = HBaseProtos.ServerName.newBuilder();
977      ServerName sn = ServerName.parseServerName(entry.getKey());
978      snBuilder.setHostName(sn.getHostname());
979      snBuilder.setPort(sn.getPort());
980      builder.setServerName(snBuilder.build());
981      builder.setTimestamp(entry.getValue());
982      tstBuilder.addServerTimestamp(builder.build());
983    }
984
985    return tstBuilder.build();
986  }
987
988  private HashMap<String, Long>
989    fromTableServerTimestampProto(BackupProtos.TableServerTimestamp proto) {
990
991    HashMap<String, Long> map = new HashMap<>();
992    List<BackupProtos.ServerTimestamp> list = proto.getServerTimestampList();
993    for (BackupProtos.ServerTimestamp st : list) {
994      ServerName sn =
995        org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shaded.protobuf.ProtobufUtil.toServerName(st.getServerName());
996      map.put(sn.getHostname() + ":" + sn.getPort(), st.getTimestamp());
997    }
998    return map;
999  }
1000
1001  /**
1002   * Return the current tables covered by incremental backup.
1003   * @param backupRoot root directory path to backup
1004   * @return set of tableNames
1005   * @throws IOException exception
1006   */
1007  public Set<TableName> getIncrementalBackupTableSet(String backupRoot) throws IOException {
1008    LOG.trace("get incremental backup table set from backup system table");
1009
1010    TreeSet<TableName> set = new TreeSet<>();
1011
1012    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1013      Get get = createGetForIncrBackupTableSet(backupRoot);
1014      Result res = table.get(get);
1015      if (res.isEmpty()) {
1016        return set;
1017      }
1018      List<Cell> cells = res.listCells();
1019      for (Cell cell : cells) {
1020        // qualifier = table name - we use table names as qualifiers
1021        set.add(TableName.valueOf(CellUtil.cloneQualifier(cell)));
1022      }
1023      return set;
1024    }
1025  }
1026
1027  /**
1028   * Add tables to global incremental backup set
1029   * @param tables     set of tables
1030   * @param backupRoot root directory path to backup
1031   * @throws IOException exception
1032   */
1033  public void addIncrementalBackupTableSet(Set<TableName> tables, String backupRoot)
1034    throws IOException {
1035    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
1036      LOG.trace("Add incremental backup table set to backup system table. ROOT=" + backupRoot
1037        + " tables [" + StringUtils.join(tables, " ") + "]");
1038    }
1039    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1040      tables.forEach(table -> LOG.debug(Objects.toString(table)));
1041    }
1042    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1043      Put put = createPutForIncrBackupTableSet(tables, backupRoot);
1044      table.put(put);
1045    }
1046  }
1047
1048  /**
1049   * Deletes incremental backup set for a backup destination
1050   * @param backupRoot backup root
1051   */
1052  public void deleteIncrementalBackupTableSet(String backupRoot) throws IOException {
1053    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
1054      LOG.trace("Delete incremental backup table set to backup system table. ROOT=" + backupRoot);
1055    }
1056    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1057      Delete delete = createDeleteForIncrBackupTableSet(backupRoot);
1058      table.delete(delete);
1059    }
1060  }
1061
1062  /**
1063   * Checks if we have at least one backup session in backup system table This API is used by
1064   * BackupLogCleaner
1065   * @return true, if - at least one session exists in backup system table table
1066   * @throws IOException exception
1067   */
1068  public boolean hasBackupSessions() throws IOException {
1069    LOG.trace("Has backup sessions from backup system table");
1070
1071    boolean result = false;
1072    Scan scan = createScanForBackupHistory();
1073    scan.setCaching(1);
1074    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName);
1075      ResultScanner scanner = table.getScanner(scan)) {
1076      if (scanner.next() != null) {
1077        result = true;
1078      }
1079      return result;
1080    }
1081  }
1082
1083  /**
1084   * BACKUP SETS
1085   */
1086
1087  /**
1088   * Get backup set list
1089   * @return backup set list
1090   * @throws IOException if a table or scanner operation fails
1091   */
1092  public List<String> listBackupSets() throws IOException {
1093    LOG.trace("Backup set list");
1094
1095    List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();
1096    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1097      Scan scan = createScanForBackupSetList();
1098      scan.readVersions(1);
1099      try (ResultScanner scanner = table.getScanner(scan)) {
1100        Result res;
1101        while ((res = scanner.next()) != null) {
1102          res.advance();
1103          list.add(cellKeyToBackupSetName(res.current()));
1104        }
1105        return list;
1106      }
1107    }
1108  }
1109
1110  /**
1111   * Get backup set description (list of tables)
1112   * @param name set's name
1113   * @return list of tables in a backup set
1114   * @throws IOException if a table operation fails
1115   */
1116  public List<TableName> describeBackupSet(String name) throws IOException {
1117    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
1118      LOG.trace(" Backup set describe: " + name);
1119    }
1120    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1121      Get get = createGetForBackupSet(name);
1122      Result res = table.get(get);
1123      if (res.isEmpty()) {
1124        return null;
1125      }
1126      res.advance();
1127      String[] tables = cellValueToBackupSet(res.current());
1128      return Arrays.asList(tables).stream().map(item -> TableName.valueOf(item))
1129        .collect(Collectors.toList());
1130    }
1131  }
1132
1133  /**
1134   * Add backup set (list of tables)
1135   * @param name      set name
1136   * @param newTables list of tables, comma-separated
1137   * @throws IOException if a table operation fails
1138   */
1139  public void addToBackupSet(String name, String[] newTables) throws IOException {
1140    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
1141      LOG.trace("Backup set add: " + name + " tables [" + StringUtils.join(newTables, " ") + "]");
1142    }
1143    String[] union = null;
1144    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1145      Get get = createGetForBackupSet(name);
1146      Result res = table.get(get);
1147      if (res.isEmpty()) {
1148        union = newTables;
1149      } else {
1150        res.advance();
1151        String[] tables = cellValueToBackupSet(res.current());
1152        union = merge(tables, newTables);
1153      }
1154      Put put = createPutForBackupSet(name, union);
1155      table.put(put);
1156    }
1157  }
1158
1159  /**
1160   * Remove tables from backup set (list of tables)
1161   * @param name     set name
1162   * @param toRemove list of tables
1163   * @throws IOException if a table operation or deleting the backup set fails
1164   */
1165  public void removeFromBackupSet(String name, String[] toRemove) throws IOException {
1166    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
1167      LOG.trace(
1168        " Backup set remove from : " + name + " tables [" + StringUtils.join(toRemove, " ") + "]");
1169    }
1170    String[] disjoint;
1171    String[] tables;
1172    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1173      Get get = createGetForBackupSet(name);
1174      Result res = table.get(get);
1175      if (res.isEmpty()) {
1176        LOG.warn("Backup set '" + name + "' not found.");
1177        return;
1178      } else {
1179        res.advance();
1180        tables = cellValueToBackupSet(res.current());
1181        disjoint = disjoin(tables, toRemove);
1182      }
1183      if (disjoint.length > 0 && disjoint.length != tables.length) {
1184        Put put = createPutForBackupSet(name, disjoint);
1185        table.put(put);
1186      } else if (disjoint.length == tables.length) {
1187        LOG.warn("Backup set '" + name + "' does not contain tables ["
1188          + StringUtils.join(toRemove, " ") + "]");
1189      } else { // disjoint.length == 0 and tables.length >0
1190        // Delete backup set
1191        LOG.info("Backup set '" + name + "' is empty. Deleting.");
1192        deleteBackupSet(name);
1193      }
1194    }
1195  }
1196
1197  private String[] merge(String[] existingTables, String[] newTables) {
1198    Set<String> tables = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(existingTables));
1199    tables.addAll(Arrays.asList(newTables));
1200    return tables.toArray(new String[0]);
1201  }
1202
1203  private String[] disjoin(String[] existingTables, String[] toRemove) {
1204    Set<String> tables = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(existingTables));
1205    Arrays.asList(toRemove).forEach(table -> tables.remove(table));
1206    return tables.toArray(new String[0]);
1207  }
1208
1209  /**
1210   * Delete backup set
1211   * @param name set's name
1212   * @throws IOException if getting or deleting the table fails
1213   */
1214  public void deleteBackupSet(String name) throws IOException {
1215    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
1216      LOG.trace(" Backup set delete: " + name);
1217    }
1218    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1219      Delete del = createDeleteForBackupSet(name);
1220      table.delete(del);
1221    }
1222  }
1223
1224  /**
1225   * Get backup system table descriptor
1226   * @return table's descriptor
1227   */
1228  public static TableDescriptor getSystemTableDescriptor(Configuration conf) {
1229    TableDescriptorBuilder builder = TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(getTableName(conf));
1230
1231    ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder colBuilder =
1232      ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(SESSIONS_FAMILY);
1233
1234    colBuilder.setMaxVersions(1);
1235    Configuration config = HBaseConfiguration.create();
1236    int ttl = config.getInt(BackupRestoreConstants.BACKUP_SYSTEM_TTL_KEY,
1237      BackupRestoreConstants.BACKUP_SYSTEM_TTL_DEFAULT);
1238    colBuilder.setTimeToLive(ttl);
1239
1240    ColumnFamilyDescriptor colSessionsDesc = colBuilder.build();
1241    builder.setColumnFamily(colSessionsDesc);
1242
1243    colBuilder = ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(META_FAMILY);
1244    colBuilder.setTimeToLive(ttl);
1245    builder.setColumnFamily(colBuilder.build());
1246    return builder.build();
1247  }
1248
1249  public static TableName getTableName(Configuration conf) {
1250    String name = conf.get(BackupRestoreConstants.BACKUP_SYSTEM_TABLE_NAME_KEY,
1251      BackupRestoreConstants.BACKUP_SYSTEM_TABLE_NAME_DEFAULT);
1252    return TableName.valueOf(name);
1253  }
1254
1255  public static String getTableNameAsString(Configuration conf) {
1256    return getTableName(conf).getNameAsString();
1257  }
1258
1259  public static String getSnapshotName(Configuration conf) {
1260    return "snapshot_" + getTableNameAsString(conf).replace(":", "_");
1261  }
1262
1263  /**
1264   * Get backup system table descriptor
1265   * @return table's descriptor
1266   */
1267  public static TableDescriptor getSystemTableForBulkLoadedDataDescriptor(Configuration conf) {
1268    TableDescriptorBuilder builder =
1269      TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(getTableNameForBulkLoadedData(conf));
1270
1271    ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder colBuilder =
1272      ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(SESSIONS_FAMILY);
1273    colBuilder.setMaxVersions(1);
1274    Configuration config = HBaseConfiguration.create();
1275    int ttl = config.getInt(BackupRestoreConstants.BACKUP_SYSTEM_TTL_KEY,
1276      BackupRestoreConstants.BACKUP_SYSTEM_TTL_DEFAULT);
1277    colBuilder.setTimeToLive(ttl);
1278    ColumnFamilyDescriptor colSessionsDesc = colBuilder.build();
1279    builder.setColumnFamily(colSessionsDesc);
1280    colBuilder = ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(META_FAMILY);
1281    colBuilder.setTimeToLive(ttl);
1282    builder.setColumnFamily(colBuilder.build());
1283    return builder.build();
1284  }
1285
1286  public static TableName getTableNameForBulkLoadedData(Configuration conf) {
1287    String name = conf.get(BackupRestoreConstants.BACKUP_SYSTEM_TABLE_NAME_KEY,
1288      BackupRestoreConstants.BACKUP_SYSTEM_TABLE_NAME_DEFAULT) + "_bulk";
1289    return TableName.valueOf(name);
1290  }

1292  /**
1293   * Creates Put operation for a given backup info object
1294   * @param context backup info
1295   * @return put operation
1296   * @throws IOException exception
1297   */
1298  private Put createPutForBackupInfo(BackupInfo context) throws IOException {
1299    Put put = new Put(rowkey(BACKUP_INFO_PREFIX, context.getBackupId()));
1300    put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.SESSIONS_FAMILY, Bytes.toBytes("context"),
1301      context.toByteArray());
1302    return put;
1303  }

1329  /**

1331   * @param res HBase result
1332   * @return backup info instance
1333   * @throws IOException exception
1334   */
1335  private BackupInfo resultToBackupInfo(Result res) throws IOException {
1336    res.advance();
1337    Cell cell = res.current();
1338    return cellToBackupInfo(cell);
1339  }

1380   */

1382    Put put = new Put(rowkey(INCR_BACKUP_SET, backupRoot));
1383    for (TableName table : tables) {
1384      put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, Bytes.toBytes(table.getNameAsString()),
1385        EMPTY_VALUE);
1386    }
1387    return put;

1400
1401  /**
1402   * Creates Scan operation to load backup history
1403   * @return scan operation
1404   */
1405  private Scan createScanForBackupHistory() {
1406    Scan scan = new Scan();
1407    byte[] startRow = Bytes.toBytes(BACKUP_INFO_PREFIX);
1408    byte[] stopRow = Arrays.copyOf(startRow, startRow.length);
1409    stopRow[stopRow.length - 1] = (byte) (stopRow[stopRow.length - 1] + 1);
1410    scan.withStartRow(startRow);
1411    scan.withStopRow(stopRow);
1412    scan.addFamily(BackupSystemTable.SESSIONS_FAMILY);
1413    scan.readVersions(1);
1414    return scan;
1415  }
1416
1417  /**
1418   * Converts cell to backup info instance.
1419   * @param current current cell
1420   * @return backup backup info instance
1421   * @throws IOException exception
1422   */
1423  private BackupInfo cellToBackupInfo(Cell current) throws IOException {
1424    byte[] data = CellUtil.cloneValue(current);
1425    return BackupInfo.fromByteArray(data);
1426  }

1501
1502  /*
1503   * Creates Put's for bulk load resulting from running LoadIncrementalHFiles
1504   */
1505  static List<Put> createPutForCommittedBulkload(TableName table, byte[] region,
1506    Map<byte[], List<Path>> finalPaths) {
1507    List<Put> puts = new ArrayList<>();
1508    for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<Path>> entry : finalPaths.entrySet()) {
1509      for (Path path : entry.getValue()) {
1510        String file = path.toString();
1511        int lastSlash = file.lastIndexOf("/");
1512        String filename = file.substring(lastSlash + 1);
1513        Put put = new Put(rowkey(BULK_LOAD_PREFIX, table.toString(), BLK_LD_DELIM,
1514          Bytes.toString(region), BLK_LD_DELIM, filename));
1515        put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, TBL_COL, table.getName());
1516        put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, FAM_COL, entry.getKey());
1517        put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, PATH_COL, Bytes.toBytes(file));
1518        put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, STATE_COL, BL_COMMIT);
1519        puts.add(put);
1520        LOG
1521          .debug("writing done bulk path " + file + " for " + table + " " + Bytes.toString(region));
1522      }
1523    }
1524    return puts;
1525  }
1526
1527  public static void snapshot(Connection conn) throws IOException {
1528    try (Admin admin = conn.getAdmin()) {
1529      Configuration conf = conn.getConfiguration();
1530      admin.snapshot(BackupSystemTable.getSnapshotName(conf), BackupSystemTable.getTableName(conf));
1531    }
1532  }
1533
1534  public static void restoreFromSnapshot(Connection conn) throws IOException {
1535    Configuration conf = conn.getConfiguration();
1536    LOG.debug("Restoring " + BackupSystemTable.getTableNameAsString(conf) + " from snapshot");
1537    try (Admin admin = conn.getAdmin()) {
1538      String snapshotName = BackupSystemTable.getSnapshotName(conf);
1539      if (snapshotExists(admin, snapshotName)) {
1540        admin.disableTable(BackupSystemTable.getTableName(conf));
1541        admin.restoreSnapshot(snapshotName);
1542        admin.enableTable(BackupSystemTable.getTableName(conf));
1543        LOG.debug("Done restoring backup system table");
1544      } else {
1545        // Snapshot does not exists, i.e completeBackup failed after
1546        // deleting backup system table snapshot
1547        // In this case we log WARN and proceed
1548        LOG.warn(
1549          "Could not restore backup system table. Snapshot " + snapshotName + " does not exists.");
1550      }
1551    }
1552  }
1553
1554  private static boolean snapshotExists(Admin admin, String snapshotName) throws IOException {
1555    List<SnapshotDescription> list = admin.listSnapshots();
1556    for (SnapshotDescription desc : list) {
1557      if (desc.getName().equals(snapshotName)) {
1558        return true;
1559      }
1560    }
1561    return false;
1562  }
1563
1564  public static boolean snapshotExists(Connection conn) throws IOException {
1565    return snapshotExists(conn.getAdmin(), getSnapshotName(conn.getConfiguration()));
1566  }
1567
1568  public static void deleteSnapshot(Connection conn) throws IOException {
1569    Configuration conf = conn.getConfiguration();
1570    LOG.debug("Deleting " + BackupSystemTable.getSnapshotName(conf) + " from the system");
1571    try (Admin admin = conn.getAdmin()) {
1572      String snapshotName = BackupSystemTable.getSnapshotName(conf);
1573      if (snapshotExists(admin, snapshotName)) {
1574        admin.deleteSnapshot(snapshotName);
1575        LOG.debug("Done deleting backup system table snapshot");
1576      } else {
1577        LOG.error("Snapshot " + snapshotName + " does not exists");
1578      }
1579    }
1580  }
1581
1582  /*
1583   * Creates Put's for bulk load resulting from running LoadIncrementalHFiles
1584   */
1585  static List<Put> createPutForPreparedBulkload(TableName table, byte[] region, final byte[] family,
1586    final List<Pair<Path, Path>> pairs) {
1587    List<Put> puts = new ArrayList<>(pairs.size());
1588    for (Pair<Path, Path> pair : pairs) {
1589      Path path = pair.getSecond();
1590      String file = path.toString();
1591      int lastSlash = file.lastIndexOf("/");
1592      String filename = file.substring(lastSlash + 1);
1593      Put put = new Put(rowkey(BULK_LOAD_PREFIX, table.toString(), BLK_LD_DELIM,
1594        Bytes.toString(region), BLK_LD_DELIM, filename));
1595      put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, TBL_COL, table.getName());
1596      put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, FAM_COL, family);
1597      put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, PATH_COL, Bytes.toBytes(file));
1598      put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, STATE_COL, BL_PREPARE);
1599      puts.add(put);
1600      LOG.debug("writing raw bulk path " + file + " for " + table + " " + Bytes.toString(region));
1601    }
1602    return puts;
1603  }
1604
1605  public static List<Delete> createDeleteForOrigBulkLoad(List<TableName> lst) {
1606    List<Delete> lstDels = new ArrayList<>(lst.size());
1607    for (TableName table : lst) {
1608      Delete del = new Delete(rowkey(BULK_LOAD_PREFIX, table.toString(), BLK_LD_DELIM));
1609      del.addFamily(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY);
1610      lstDels.add(del);
1611    }
1612    return lstDels;
1613  }
1614
1615  private Put createPutForDeleteOperation(String[] backupIdList) {
1616    byte[] value = Bytes.toBytes(StringUtils.join(backupIdList, ","));
1617    Put put = new Put(DELETE_OP_ROW);
1618    put.addColumn(META_FAMILY, FAM_COL, value);
1619    return put;
1620  }
1621
1622  private Delete createDeleteForBackupDeleteOperation() {
1623    Delete delete = new Delete(DELETE_OP_ROW);
1624    delete.addFamily(META_FAMILY);
1625    return delete;
1626  }
1627
1628  private Get createGetForDeleteOperation() {
1629    Get get = new Get(DELETE_OP_ROW);
1630    get.addFamily(META_FAMILY);
1631    return get;
1632  }
1633
1634  public void startDeleteOperation(String[] backupIdList) throws IOException {
1635    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
1636      LOG.trace("Start delete operation for backups: " + StringUtils.join(backupIdList));
1637    }
1638    Put put = createPutForDeleteOperation(backupIdList);
1639    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1640      table.put(put);
1641    }
1642  }
1643
1644  public void finishDeleteOperation() throws IOException {
1645    LOG.trace("Finsih delete operation for backup ids");
1646
1647    Delete delete = createDeleteForBackupDeleteOperation();
1648    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1649      table.delete(delete);
1650    }
1651  }
1652
1653  public String[] getListOfBackupIdsFromDeleteOperation() throws IOException {
1654    LOG.trace("Get delete operation for backup ids");
1655
1656    Get get = createGetForDeleteOperation();
1657    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1658      Result res = table.get(get);
1659      if (res.isEmpty()) {
1660        return null;
1661      }
1662      Cell cell = res.listCells().get(0);
1663      byte[] val = CellUtil.cloneValue(cell);
1664      if (val.length == 0) {
1665        return null;
1666      }
1667      return Splitter.on(',').splitToStream(new String(val, StandardCharsets.UTF_8))
1668        .toArray(String[]::new);
1669    }
1670  }
1671
1672  private Put createPutForMergeOperation(String[] backupIdList) {
1673    byte[] value = Bytes.toBytes(StringUtils.join(backupIdList, ","));
1674    Put put = new Put(MERGE_OP_ROW);
1675    put.addColumn(META_FAMILY, FAM_COL, value);
1676    return put;
1677  }
1678
1679  public boolean isMergeInProgress() throws IOException {
1680    Get get = new Get(MERGE_OP_ROW);
1681    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1682      Result res = table.get(get);
1683      return !res.isEmpty();
1684    }
1685  }

1689    Put put = new Put(MERGE_OP_ROW);
1690    put.addColumn(META_FAMILY, PATH_COL, value);
1691    return put;
1692  }

1708      LOG.trace("Start merge operation for backups: " + StringUtils.join(backupIdList));
1709    }
1710    Put put = createPutForMergeOperation(backupIdList);
1711    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1712      table.put(put);
1713    }
1714  }
1715
1716  public void updateProcessedTablesForMerge(List<TableName> tables) throws IOException {
1717    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
1718      LOG.trace("Update tables for merge : " + StringUtils.join(tables, ","));
1719    }
1720    Put put = createPutForUpdateTablesForMerge(tables);
1721    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1722      table.put(put);
1723    }
1724  }

1727    LOG.trace("Finish merge operation for backup ids");
1728
1729    Delete delete = createDeleteForBackupMergeOperation();
1730    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1731      table.delete(delete);
1732    }
1733  }
1734
1735  public String[] getListOfBackupIdsFromMergeOperation() throws IOException {
1736    LOG.trace("Get backup ids for merge operation");
1737
1738    Get get = createGetForMergeOperation();
1739    try (Table table = connection.getTable(tableName)) {
1740      Result res = table.get(get);
1741      if (res.isEmpty()) {
1742        return null;
1743      }
1744      Cell cell = res.listCells().get(0);
1745      byte[] val = CellUtil.cloneValue(cell);
1746      if (val.length == 0) {
1747        return null;
1748      }
1749      return Splitter.on(',').splitToStream(new String(val, StandardCharsets.UTF_8))
1750        .toArray(String[]::new);
1751    }
1752  }
1753
1754  static Scan createScanForOrigBulkLoadedFiles(TableName table) {
1755    Scan scan = new Scan();
1756    byte[] startRow = rowkey(BULK_LOAD_PREFIX, table.toString(), BLK_LD_DELIM);
1757    byte[] stopRow = Arrays.copyOf(startRow, startRow.length);
1758    stopRow[stopRow.length - 1] = (byte) (stopRow[stopRow.length - 1] + 1);
1759    scan.withStartRow(startRow);
1760    scan.withStopRow(stopRow);
1761    scan.addFamily(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY);
1762    scan.readVersions(1);
1763    return scan;
1764  }
1765
1766  static String getTableNameFromOrigBulkLoadRow(String rowStr) {
1767    // format is bulk : namespace : table : region : file
1768    return Iterators.get(Splitter.onPattern(BLK_LD_DELIM).split(rowStr).iterator(), 1);
1769  }
1770
1771  static String getRegionNameFromOrigBulkLoadRow(String rowStr) {
1772    // format is bulk : namespace : table : region : file
1773    List<String> parts = Splitter.onPattern(BLK_LD_DELIM).splitToList(rowStr);
1774    Iterator<String> i = parts.iterator();
1775    int idx = 3;
1776    if (parts.size() == 4) {
1777      // the table is in default namespace
1778      idx = 2;
1779    }
1780    String region = Iterators.get(i, idx);
1781    LOG.debug("bulk row string " + rowStr + " region " + region);
1782    return region;
1783  }
1784
1785  /*
1786   * Used to query bulk loaded hfiles which have been copied by incremental backup
1787   * @param backupId the backup Id. It can be null when querying for all tables
1788   * @return the Scan object
1789   */
1790  static Scan createScanForBulkLoadedFiles(String backupId) {
1791    Scan scan = new Scan();
1792    byte[] startRow =
1793      backupId == null ? BULK_LOAD_PREFIX_BYTES : rowkey(BULK_LOAD_PREFIX, backupId + BLK_LD_DELIM);
1794    byte[] stopRow = Arrays.copyOf(startRow, startRow.length);
1795    stopRow[stopRow.length - 1] = (byte) (stopRow[stopRow.length - 1] + 1);
1796    scan.withStartRow(startRow);
1797    scan.withStopRow(stopRow);
1798    scan.addFamily(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY);
1799    scan.readVersions(1);
1800    return scan;
1801  }
1802
1803  static Put createPutForBulkLoadedFile(TableName tn, byte[] fam, String p, String backupId,
1804    long ts, int idx) {
1805    Put put = new Put(rowkey(BULK_LOAD_PREFIX, backupId + BLK_LD_DELIM + ts + BLK_LD_DELIM + idx));
1806    put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, TBL_COL, tn.getName());
1807    put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, FAM_COL, fam);
1808    put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, PATH_COL, Bytes.toBytes(p));
1809    return put;
1810  }

1848  /**
1849   * Creates Put operation to update backup set content
1850   * @param name   backup set's name
1851   * @param tables list of tables
1852   * @return put operation
1853   */
1854  private Put createPutForBackupSet(String name, String[] tables) {
1855    Put put = new Put(rowkey(SET_KEY_PREFIX, name));
1856    byte[] value = convertToByteArray(tables);
1857    put.addColumn(BackupSystemTable.META_FAMILY, Bytes.toBytes("tables"), value);
1858    return put;

1860
1861  private byte[] convertToByteArray(String[] tables) {
1862    return Bytes.toBytes(StringUtils.join(tables, ","));
1863  }
1864
1865  /**
1866   * Converts cell to backup set list.
1867   * @param current current cell
1868   * @return backup set as array of table names
1869   */
1870  private String[] cellValueToBackupSet(Cell current) {
1871    byte[] data = CellUtil.cloneValue(current);
1872    if (!ArrayUtils.isEmpty(data)) {
1873      return Bytes.toString(data).split(",");
1874    }
1875    return new String[0];
1876  }
1877
1878  /**
1879   * Converts cell key to backup set name.
1880   * @param current current cell
1881   * @return backup set name
1882   */
1883  private String cellKeyToBackupSetName(Cell current) {
1884    byte[] data = CellUtil.cloneRow(current);
1885    return Bytes.toString(data).substring(SET_KEY_PREFIX.length());
1886  }
1887
1888  private static byte[] rowkey(String s, String... other) {
1889    StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(s);
1890    for (String ss : other) {
1891      sb.append(ss);
1892    }
1893    return Bytes.toBytes(sb.toString());
1894  }
1895
1896  private static void ensureTableEnabled(Admin admin, TableName tableName) throws IOException {
1897    if (!admin.isTableEnabled(tableName)) {
1898      try {
1899        admin.enableTable(tableName);
1900      } catch (TableNotDisabledException ignored) {
1901        LOG.info("Table {} is not disabled, ignoring enable request", tableName);
1902      }
1903    }
1904  }
1905}
